title: The images are not shown after the app came back from the background
body:
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open 1-1 chat
2. Send images
3. Send the app into background mode
4. Send device into sleeping mode
5. WAIT AT LEAST 3-4 MINUTES
6. Go back to the app -> open the chat
7. Send images

**Actual result:**
Old and newly sent Images are not shown

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52490791/213688616-3c4d035e-df3b-4359-8d97-ab955fe2ed78.mp4


**Expected result:**
Images are still shown

**ENV:** iPhone 11 Pro max, v15
**Logs:** 
[Status.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/10465950/Status.log)
[geth.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/10465952/geth.log)

Trying to reproduce on simulator,
Sent few images then put app on background and then tried sending images again and it worked fine. 

![Screenshot 2023-02-09 at 8 31 05 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64726664/217849197-ca9bd016-4ffd-4d71-8ee5-a7e96964a078.png)

I will try again though :)
@VladimrLitvinenko : was this tested on real device or simulator?

@VladimrLitvinenko : could you please try replicating with this build? https://i.diawi.com/RgviBK
We have enabled more logs and these logs would give us a better understanding of whats going on if you are able to reproduce this issue again :)

> https://i.diawi.com/RgviBK

Hey @siddarthkay ! Thanx for the build. It turned out that there is no clear 100% way to reproduce the bug. We will need more efforts to do this. I guess we will spend more time on investigation after we finish testing RC-1. Will keep you updated on that.

> @VladimrLitvinenko : was this tested on real device or simulator?

We usually use real devices for testing.
@pavloburykh : I was able to reproduce this error on real device after putting it to sleep, as specified in error reproduction steps, currently going through logs to figure out what went wrong

> @pavloburykh : I was able to reproduce this error on real device after putting it to sleep, as specified in error reproduction steps, currently going through logs to figure out what went wrong

great news @siddarthkay ! thanx. As I had no luck to reproduce following steps from description

Okay so far we have discovered the following : 
- When app is in "foreground" mode all the urls generated by the media server are working as expected,
 it is when the app goes to sleep for about 5+ minutes there is an app-state change event and most likely the media server is not available at that moment, which results in a white patch where the image should be.
When you close the app and restart it, the images are properly displayed. This means that the media server is available and functional after re-login.

-when the app is restarted, the media server is also restarted.
I am currently trying to isolate the root cause of this issue by generating PR builds and testing them on my devices.

Thanks to @cammellos and @Samyoul for helping with debugging.
status go branch : https://github.com/status-im/status-go/commits/debug/media-server
status mobile PR(for builds only) : https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/15061

Will log more workflows and hypothesis in this issue below.

In this case below, I sent 2 images to a new contact via chat, put the app in sleep for 5+ minutes and when I opened the chat again to send 1 more image we see this white gap : Now looking at these logs : [geth.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/10727275/geth.log) [Status.log](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/10727278/Status.log) I see a "preparing image" in `geth.log` for all 3 images which was written in messenger before the media server is asked for an image url : https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/7d9158066cf1e2eb8a1dea038b1af0d2a6ebf56f/protocol/messenger.go#L4445 I also see a "prepared image" in `geth.log` for all 3 images which was written in messenger after the media server is asked for an image url : https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/7d9158066cf1e2eb8a1dea038b1af0d2a6ebf56f/protocol/messenger.go#L4447 But , I only see a "handling image" in `geth.log` for first 2 images which was written in the handler part of the media server : https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/7d9158066cf1e2eb8a1dea038b1af0d2a6ebf56f/server/handlers.go#L326 so what this means is that the media server was _unavailable_ to handle the 3rd request and hence the white space we see.

now that we know that the media server can be _unavailable_ or _sleeping_ at this particular situation the fix would be to wake it up by some sort of signal or api call from the client side.
We would only want to do this whenever the client discovers that the media server is sleeping when it should not be.

Now this could be as simple as restarting the media server, but I do not know the implications of that, I will explore more and find out.

`INFO [react-native.fast-image:38] - uri when not loaded {:uri "https://Localhost:55972/messages/images?messageId=0x0c2eaeba19dfe2f7f8eb0833574c0ebd6a743a108764ec9451205e91f4ccca73"}` log in `Status.log` accurately captures the message Id and the image url that was not loaded on mobile, it seems to be a good starting point to experiment with restarting the Media Server.

Thinking more about it, the issue really is that `MakeImageURL` in `server_media.go` is returning a URL that is not valid 
ref : https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/f6b4721c4a74f05049b1309c3250ed803d936c59/server/server_media.go#L68
What the function does is adding a base url and creating a url pattern that is supposed to trigger the corresponding handler method  in  `handlers.go` when any client calls it( or sends an HTTP GET request to it).
In case of this issue, the said URL is probably not returning an http status 200.

We should  validate any and every URL before it is shared with the client, the validation logic is simple, status-go can make a GET request and if the response has a status code of 200 we can consider that the URL is valid.

> returning a URL that is not valid

just to clarify : not valid only because the mediaserver is asleep / non responsive, the URL becomes valid after logout and login, i.e a restart

> just to clarify : not valid only because the mediaserver is asleep / non responsive, the URL becomes valid after logout and login, i.e a restart

Just to clarify, the url is generated each time we serve a message with image to the client, so it doesn't "become valid", it's a new url pointing to a new instance of the server, which after logout/login is responsive (probably that's what you meant, but just to neatpick :) )

> We should validate any and every URL before it is shared with the client, the validation logic is simple, status-go can make a GET request and if the response has a status code of 200 we can consider that the URL is valid

This is not likely the way to go about it, status-go should know if the server is listening without having to make an http request, there should be a better way to handle this (ideally the server resumes as normal after sleep, since it looks we haven't found yet the root cause), @Samyoul what do you think?
@status-im/mobile-qa : we've fixed this issue, would you mind checking a recent build here : https://i.diawi.com/m2uezA
oops, didn't mean to close this issue just yet.. maybe merging the status-go PR automatically closed this one, re-opening for now

@churik @VladimrLitvinenko this should be resolved in develop/release, feel free to close the issue once that's verified.
Thank you!

> @churik @VladimrLitvinenko this should be resolved in develop/release, feel free to close the issue once that's verified. Thank you!

Thank you. I will provide the feedback soon
@cammellos @siddarthkay it is not reproducible anymore. Thank you for your work!
